intro: Lagarinthus linearis, commonly known as the slender blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Lagarinthus linearis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
